titles: The English gentlevvoman, drawne out to the full body expressing, what habilliments doe best attire her, what ornaments doe best adorne her, what complements doe best accomplish her. By Richard Brathvvait Esq.
author: Brathwaite, Richard, 1588?-1673.
Marshall, William, fl. 1617-1650, engraver.
publisher: Printed by B. Alsop and T. Favvcet, for Michaell Sparke, dwelling in Greene Arbor,
notes: With an additional title page, engraved, signed: Will: Marshall. fec.
The folded leaf bears "The meaning of the frontispice".
P. 229 misnumbered 221; the previous 7 pages are unnumbered.
This state lacks the appendix, quires 2H-2I, though 24v mentions it. Variant 1: 24v lacks mention of the appendix.
With a final errata leaf, signed "Kk". Variant 2: errata leaf signed "Ii". Variant 3: errata on a bifolium, first leaf signed "Zz", second leaf blank. Variant 4: errata leaf lacking.
Reproduction of the original in Cambridge University Library.
keywords: Women --  Conduct of life --  Early works to 1800.
Clothing and dress --  Early works to 1800.
